sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Handwritten letter from Hans Weisse to Schenker, dated June 21, 1932
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: Weisse acknowledges receipt of two letters from Schenker, but has been burdened by visa problems at the American consulate in Vienna. He will reply at greater length when he arrives in Grundlsee, in a few days’ time.
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: Konsulat; consulate; Pass; passport; Visum; visa; Schwierigkeiten; difficulties; Kontrakt; contract; Adresse; address

tei:opener.tei:salute: Lieber MeisterReceipt of this letter is recorded in Schenker's diary at OJ 4/5, p. 3742, June 22, 1932: "Von Weisse (Br.): will auf meinen Brief später zurückkommen; eine neue Adresse: Grundlsee." ("From Weisse (letter): he will get back to me about my letter later; a new address: Grundlsee.").

tei:div.tei:p:
Ihre beiden letzten Briefe, will ich dann, sowie ich in GrundlseeGrundlsee, a village on the Grundlsee, a lake in Styria, not far from the town of Bad Aussee, where Weisse had spent previous summer vacations.
bin, beantworten.
Einstweilen bitte ich Sie dies nur als Empfangsbestätigung Ihrer Briefe ansehen zu wollen. Dass Sie zufrieden sind freut uns beide sehr. Wir wünschen Ihnen beste Erholung.

tei:closer.tei:salute: Viele herzliche Grüsse von uns beiden an Sie beide!

tei:div.tei:p: I am at present in such a great flurry with the consulate ‒ passport and visa problems ‒ that I am unable to find the necessary composure with which to reply in detail to you and your letters, and I ask you to have patience until the 26th or 27th, as I am travelling to Bad Aussee tomorrow and will write to you from there. The consulate is making things difficult: a one-year contract is not sufficient for them, and so yesterday I had to telegraph America regarding the extension of my contract. This has again delayed the issue of my visa, and I shall probably have to travel to Vienna once again to sort things out.

I shall answer your two most recent letters as soon as I am in
Grundlsee.
For the time being, please regard this letter only as confirmation of the receipt of your letters. That you are happy gives us both joy. We hope you have a very good rest.

tei:closer.tei:salute: Many cordial greetings from the two of us to the two of you!
